title: If you agreed to do something 'biweekly,' did you agree to do it once every two weeks or two times each week? - Quora

response.answer_text: The English language needs a little help here. I propose that from now on, we use "bi" and "di" in a new way, "Bi-weekly" would mean twice weekly. "Di-weekly" would mean every other week. You protest that it's an innovation. But linguistic innovation happens all the time. This would finally be a good innovation for a change. PS; This would work with "monthly", "yearly" "centenially", etc.

“If you agreed to do something "biweekly," did you agree to do it once every two weeks or two times each week?” For many years, I edited a bi-monthly magazine. It came out every other month — January, March, May, July, September and November.
